name: Tartarus
shortDescription: Deepest abyss of the Underworld, prison for Titans and the wickedest souls
fullDescription: Tartarus is the deepest, darkest region of the cosmos‚Äîas far below Hades as Heaven is above Earth. Originally a primordial deity, Tartarus became the ultimate prison where Zeus imprisoned the Titans after the Titanomachy. Surrounded by bronze walls and shrouded in perpetual darkness, Tartarus holds those who defied the gods: the Titans Cronus and his brothers, the Giants after the Gigantomachy, and mortals guilty of supreme hubris like Sisyphus, Tantalus, and Ixion. Each receives eternal, specially designed punishment. Tartarus represents divine justice in its most severe form‚Äîeternal punishment for cosmic crimes. The very air is described as murky and oppressive, and the place exists beyond hope of escape or redemption.
